snippet: The new rule, limiting emissions of carbon dioxide and other greenhouse gases, drew legal and technical objections from the electric power industry.
abstract: Environmental Protection Agency says it will delay issuance of rule limiting emissions of carbon dioxide and other greenhouse gases from new coal-fired power plants; says rule needs rewrites to address legal and technical concerns raised by electric power industry.
lead_paragraph: The new rule, limiting emissions of carbon dioxide and other greenhouse gases, drew legal and technical objections from the electric power industry.

headline.seo: E.P.A. to Delay Emissions Rule at New Power Plants
headline.main: E.P.A. Will Delay Rule Limiting Carbon Emissions at New Power Plants
headline.print_headline: Federal Rule for New Power Plants Is Delayed
